question_title: Will PCG's market close price on 2026-02-13 be higher than its market close price on 2026-02-04?
summary: PCG's Feb 13 close vs Feb 4 close ($15.895) depends heavily on the Q4 2025 earnings call scheduled for Feb 12. PG&E has a strong track record of beating estimates (Q3 beat by 13.64%) and has unanimous Buy ratings from analysts with 30% upside to price targets. However, today's +3.62% move sets a higher baseline, and earnings events introduce significant uncertainty. The positive company fundamentals and beat history provide a slight edge toward YES, but this is close to a coin flip given earnings uncertainty.

factors.description: Earnings call on Feb 12 with company's strong beat history (Q3 beat by 13.64%) suggests positive reaction likely
Unanimous analyst Buy rating (13/13) with average price target 30% above current price indicates bullish sentiment
Today's +3.62% move sets an elevated baseline, potentially pricing in some optimism already
Earnings events are inherently unpredictable - even beats can trigger 'sell the news' reactions
Strong company growth narrative (data centers, EVs, 9%+ annual EPS growth guidance) supports positive outlook
